meanings.definition: A fight or contest characterized by heavy blows or punches.
meanings.sent1: The two boxers engaged in a slugfest, exchanging powerful punches.
meanings.sent2: The slugfest between the two teams lasted for hours, with neither side willing to back down.
meanings.sent3: During the family reunion, Uncle Joe and Aunt Mary had a friendly slugfest over who makes the best apple pie.
meanings.sent4: The political debate turned into a slugfest as each candidate tried to land verbal blows on their opponent.
meanings.sent5: The slugfest in the final round of the championship match left the audience on the edge of their seats.

meanings.definition: A heated and intense argument or debate.
meanings.sent1: The meeting turned into a slugfest as different opinions clashed.
meanings.sent2: The slugfest between the two politicians was broadcast live on television.
meanings.sent3: At the town hall meeting, the discussion on the new park design became a slugfest of ideas.
meanings.sent4: The slugfest between the two siblings over the last slice of pizza escalated quickly.
meanings.sent5: The online forum became a slugfest of comments as users debated the best movie of the year.
